title.value: ConceptGraphs: Open-Vocabulary 3D Scene Graphs for Perception and Planning
title.justification: This is the title provided at the beginning of the research paper.
title.quote: ConceptGraphs: Open-Vocabulary 3D Scene Graphs for Perception and Planning

extractions.description: The paper proposes ConceptGraphs, an open-vocabulary graph-structured representation for 3D scenes tailored for robot perception and planning. By leveraging 2D foundation models and fusing their output to 3D through multiview association, the approach creates a semantically rich and compact 3D representation useful for complex task execution like navigation and manipulation.

type.justification: The paper presents experiments, implementations, and evaluations of the proposed ConceptGraphs system on various robotic platforms and real-world tasks.
type.quote: We implement and demonstrate ConceptGraphs on a number of real-world robotics tasks across wheeled and legged mobile robot platforms.

name.justification: The paper leverages foundation models, large vision-language models, and large language models which are key elements in deep learning research.
name.quote: ConceptGraphs is built by leveraging 2D foundation models and fusing their output to 3D by multiview association.

name.justification: The research deals with 3D scene representation, object detection, segmentation, and spatial reasoning, all of which fall under the domain of computer vision.
name.quote: We propose a novel object-centric mapping system that integrates geometric cues from traditional 3D mapping systems and semantic cues from 2D foundation models.

name.justification: This is the main model proposed and named in the paper.
name.quote: We propose ConceptGraphs, an open-vocabulary and object-centric 3D representation for robot perception and planning.

name.justification: The paper uses Segment Anything for segmentation tasks.
name.quote: Our experiments use SegmentAnything (SAM) [33] as the segmentation model Seg(·)

name.justification: CLIP is used for obtaining visual descriptors.
name.quote: Each extracted mask mt,i is then passed to a visual feature extractor (CLIP [31], DINO [53]) to obtain a visual descriptor ft,i =Embed(Itrgb , mt,i ).

name.justification: DINO is used alongside CLIP for obtaining visual descriptors.
name.quote: Each extracted mask mt,i is then passed to a visual feature extractor (CLIP [31], DINO [53]) to obtain a visual descriptor ft,i =Embed(Itrgb , mt,i ).

name.justification: LLaVA is used as the vision-language model for generating captions.
name.quote: We use LLaVA [55] as the vision-language model LVLM

name.justification: GPT-4 is employed as the language model for semantic understanding and querying.
name.quote: We use ... GPT-4 [32] (gpt-4-0613) for our LLM.

name.justification: The paper uses Replica data scenes for evaluating scene graph accuracy.
name.quote: We first evaluate the accuracy of the 3D scene graphs output by the ConceptGraphs system in Table I. For each scene in the Replica dataset [56], we report scene graph accuracy metrics.

name.justification: AI2Thor is used for simulation experiments.
name.quote: We showcase this with a … localization and remapping task in the AI2Thor [63], [64] simulation environment.

name.justification: Open3d SLAM is used for building pointcloud maps.
name.quote: For our navigation experiments with the Jackal robot. Our robot is equipped with a VLP-16 lidar and a foward-facing Realsense D435i camera. We begin by building a pointcloud of the REAL Lab using the onboard VLP-16 and Open3d SLAM [68].

name.justification: RTAB-Map is used for obtaining camera poses and the scene point cloud.
name.quote: We then stage two separate scenes with different objects: one for object search and another for traversability estimation. In both cases, we map the scene with an Azure Kinect Camera and rely on RTAB-Map [69] to obtain camera poses and the scene point cloud.
